updated at NNDC. Originally compiled by KaChaPaG and
updated by CaJaD.

bib_record.title: Absolute cross sections for deuteron-induced reactions on 6Li at energies below 1 MeV.

free_txt: Measured differential data corrected for background
and small electronic dead time effects.
Total integrated charge and the average projectile
energy corrected for carbon build up on the face of
the target.
Energies given are average deuteron energies in LiF
targets.
Target thickness determined by Rutherford scattering
of 1 MeV alpha particles from F and by measuring the
energy loss of deuterons in the LiF layer.
Thin films of LiF (75-100 microgram/cm2), enriched to
99.3% 6Li, evaporated onto thin 10 to 15 microgram/cm2
carbon foils.
Approved by A.J. Elwyn, 29 December 2000.
Si surface-barrier detector.
Data taken from Table VIII of reference.
Yields from the measured relative angular
distributions were divided by the values at 90 degrees
and normalized to a separately measured 90 degrees
excitation function. The total cross section at each
energy was Obtained by fitting the angular
distributions with Legendre polynomials.
Si surface-barrier detectors.
Error given includes statistical uncertainty
and uncertainty in fitting procedure.
Absolute uncertainties are estimated to be between 8
and 13%, and include errors associated with the yield
determination and charge collection and uncertainties
in target thickness, average deuteron energy and
solid angle determination.
Coefficients of Legendre polynomials are
given in Table III of reference.  Cross section data
were calculated by the compiler by multiplying the
zero-order coefficient by 4pi.
Si surface-barrier detector.
Data taken from Table VI of reference.
Yields from the measured relative angular
distributions were divided by the values at 90 degrees
and normalized to a separately measured 90 degrees
excitation function. The total cross section at each
energy was Obtained by fitting the angular
distributions with Legendre polynomials.
Si surface-barrier detector.
Error given includes statistical uncertainty
and uncertainty in fitting procedure.
Absolute uncertainties are estimated to be between 8
and 13%, and include errors associated with the yield
determination and charge collection and uncertainties
in target thickness, average deuteron energy and
solid angle determination.
Coefficients of Legendre polynomials are
given in Table IV of reference.  Cross section data
were calculated by the compiler by multiplying the
zero-order coefficient by 4pi.
Si surface-barrier detector.
. 3.5-meters flight path.
Data taken from Table VII of reference.
Yields from the measured relative angular
distributions were divided by the values at 90 degrees
and normalized to a separately measured 90 degrees
excitation function. The total cross section at each
energy was Obtained by fitting the angular
distributions with Legendre polynomials.
Cylindrical Stilbene scintillators.
Error given includes statistical uncertainty
and uncertainty in fitting procedure.
Absolute total cross sections have estimated
uncertainties of 13-16%.
Absolute detector efficiencies were determined
in a separate measurement using the 7Li(p,n)7Be and
2H(d,n)3He reactions.
Coefficients of Legendre polynomials are
given in Table V of reference.  Cross section data
were calculated by the compiler by multiplying the
zero-order coefficient by 4pi.
